meanings.definition: To restore normal heart rhythm by applying an electric shock
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to defibrillate the patient to save their life.
meanings.sent2: In an emergency, it is crucial to defibrillate quickly to help the heart.
meanings.sent3: Why did the heart have to be defibrillated? It was feeling a bit out of rhythm!
meanings.sent4: The electric shock seemed to defibrillate the heart back to life.
meanings.sent5: With a jolt, the defibrillator was able to defibrillate the heart, bringing it back to its normal rhythm.

meanings.definition: The act of using a defibrillator to treat cardiac arrest
meanings.sent1: After the cardiac arrest, the paramedic performed a defibrillate.
meanings.sent2: The defibrillate was successful in restarting the heart's rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The defibrillate was so loud that it startled the entire room.
meanings.sent4: The defibrillate was like a superhero swooping in to save the day.
meanings.sent5: The quick use of the defibrillate saved the patient's life.
